name: Cultist robes
description: Relatively simple but form-fitting long dark robes made of cloth. Comes with a hood. Usually worn by novice cultists and those in other magical covenants.

name: Cultist ritual robes
description: Relatively simple but form-fitting long dark robes made of cloth. Comes with a hood that's adorned with small horns of some creature. Usually worn by cultists about to perform a ritual and those in more esoteric magical covenants.

name: Cultist priest robes
description: Relatively simple but form-fitting long dark robes made of cloth. Upon its shoulders hangs an extra piece of ceremonious or symbolic cloth decorated in various runes and symbols. Comes with a hood. Usually worn by the spiritual leaders of the cultists and those in magical covenants.

name: Cultist commune robes
description: Relatively simple but form-fitting long dark robes made of cloth. It bears a symbol that marks all who bear it as part of a commune. Comes with a hood. Usually worn by more reclusive but tightly-knit communities of cultists and magic practitioners.

name: Cultist elder robes
description: Form-fitting long dark robes made of cloth and decorated with golden symbolism and runic inscriptions. Upon its shoulders hangs an extra piece of ceremonious or symbolic cloth decorated in even more various runes and symbols. Comes with a hood that bears a crown of some sort. Only the leaders of cultists and magical covenants wear such attire. One might think that the gold and symbols increase ones magical affinity, but no, they're mostly for show. At least the gold offers better protection than plain cloth.

name: Cultist defender robes
description: Form-fitting long dark robes with a hood made to be more protective than what is worn usually worn by cultists and magical practitioners. Leather is used for the majority of its construction, with cloth used to pad its internals and chainmail to armour up its externals, even the hood. Steel plate was used for the shoulders, chest, and forearms. The cultish defenders who use this armour usually suplement it with armoured gauntlets, boots, and a steel mask if they don't quite have the gift of magic as the rest of their kind, otherwise those sections are left unhindered to cast a deadly variety of spells and summons.
A patch used to mark robes intended for ritual use.
A patch used to mark robes intended for use by priests.
A patch used to mark robes intended for use by a commune.
A patch used to mark robes intended for use by the elder of that group.
This is a large bone, with a lit candle mounted to one end. It has been engraved with several runes, and seems to hold magical power. The candle never seems to extinguish.

name: Lifesteal Longsword
description: A black longsword, engraved with runes and emits a green smog. When an opponent is struck, a portion of their life is returned to the wielder.
A enchanted ring, inscribed with strange runes and symbols. It gives the wearer the ability to take on a ghastly form at will.
A purple mask, decorated with feathers, beads, etc. The center herbors two errie, bulging eyes, with slits cut for sight. It seems to call to you.
